lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.

Cindy Lewis is a girl you have had a crush on for a very long time. A friend of hers tells you that Cindy told her that all she dreams about is going out with you and "being" with you. There is only one problem--Cindy has a boyfriend
You arrange, through the friend, to meet Cindy in secret at a fast food restaurant.

You hear, through the friend, that Cindy agrees to meet you there at two o'clock this Saturday. You have already made plans for Saturday afternoon with the girl you are seeing and you will have to lie in order to break them.
You succeed in breaking your date for Saturday.
You get to the restaurant a bit early and get a large order of french fries.
It's two-fifteen and the fries are gone. If you spend any more money, you will have nothing with which to buy Cindy a soda.
At two-thirty you order a small cola.
At two-forty-five you think you see someone who looks like her come through the large glass door. You heart begins to race....
The person who actually walks through the door is old enough to be your grandmother. All of this waiting is causing you to see things.
At three o'clock the person who sweeps up and cleans the tables asks if you still want the cup from your cola, which you have mangled and broken up into little pieces. You say, "Yes."
At three-fifteen you think about whether or not you should try to call Cindy at home.
You call...the line is busy. Maybe she is trying to reach you at your house.
You call your house. There is no answer. It is three forty-five.
It's eleven p.m.. I can't believe you waited for her for almost nine hours!
